User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the React Refinery application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

points.description: Gamification points earned by the user.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

isSeed.description: A temporary flag used only for the initial database seeding process.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project containing React code uploaded by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the project entity.

description.description: A brief description of the project.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the project was created.

CodeFile.title: CodeFile
CodeFile.description: Represents a single React code file within a project.

id.description: Unique identifier for the code file entity.

fileName.description: The name of the code file.

fileContent.description: The actual content of the React code file.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the code file was uploaded.

lastModified.description: Timestamp indicating when the code file was last modified.

AISuggestion.title: AISuggestion
AISuggestion.description: Represents an AI-powered refactoring suggestion for a code file.

id.description: Unique identifier for the AI suggestion entity.

suggestionText.description: The text of the AI suggestion.

suggestedChange.description: The suggested change to the code (e.g., a code snippet).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the suggestion was generated.

Symptom.title: Symptom
Symptom.description: Represents a single symptom entry logged by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the symptom entry.

userId.description: Reference to the User who logged the symptom.

severity.description: The severity of the symptom, on a scale (e.g., 1-10).

frequency.description: The frequency of the symptom, on a scale (e.g., 1-10).

date.description: The date the symptom was recorded.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the entry was created.

DiscussionPost.title: DiscussionPost
DiscussionPost.description: Represents a single discussion post in the community forum.

id.description: Unique identifier for the discussion post.

userId.description: Reference to the User who created the post.

username.description: The username of the user who created the post.

title.description: The title of the discussion post.

content.description: The main content of the discussion post.

category.description: The category slug for the discussion post.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the post was created.

isSeed.description: A temporary flag used only for the initial database seeding process.

Bookmark.title: Bookmark
Bookmark.description: Represents a user's bookmark of a discussion post.

postId.description: The ID of the bookmarked discussion post.

userId.description: The ID of the user who created the bookmark.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the bookmark was created.

PostReport.title: PostReport
PostReport.description: Represents a report filed by a user against a discussion post.

postId.description: The ID of the reported discussion post.

reporterId.description: The ID of the user who filed the report.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the report was filed.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging, in accordance with the defined principles.  Authorization Independence is achieved by leveraging path-based ownership for private user data and avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. Structural Segregation is applied by storing user-specific data under `/users/{userId}`. Access Modeling uses path-based ownership for the `User -> Project -> CodeFile -> AISuggestion` hierarchy and the `User -> Symptom` hierarchy. The new `/discussions` collection is at the root level to allow public read access for all authenticated users, while write access is managed to ensure data integrity and ownership for create/update/delete actions. The `category` field has been added to the `DiscussionPost` entity to allow for content organization without needing a separate categories collection for this MVP.
